title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 21, 2019).

Johnson is set to bring his Brexit deal back to Parliament for a critical vote after lawmakers forced the prime minister to ask the EU for another delay to Britain's withdrawal.

Trump faces increasing Republican scrutiny over a series of recent moves as a House impeachment inquiry makes him more vulnerable to attacks within the party.

The Kurdish-led SDF said its fighters withdrew from a key border town in northeastern Syria, fulfilling a part of the U.S.-Turkey cease-fire agreement.

Esper and Pelosi made unannounced visits to Afghanistan to reassure the government that the U.S. wouldn't abandon the country.

The Trump administration's cuts to the refugee program will make it harder for a future administration to resume accepting refugees.

Judicial vacancies and a wave of immigration cases are threatening to overwhelm the federal court system in New Mexico.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 21, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
